programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack grooms E.Z. for a date with a high-class girl who only seems interested in Jack.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After Jack saves James' life, James finds Jack to be the son he never had.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack and Vicky are cast in a commercial for her airline, Jack fights with the temperamental director.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James moves in to care for Vicky when she comes down with the measles.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack's old friend, Larry invites him to a swinging party where an old flame makes a move on Jack.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack convinces Vicky to invest in a case of vintage wine, but when it turns out to be sour, he takes a job at a sushi house to repay her.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After Jack and James get drunk together, James is arrested for urinating in public and ends up in court.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard stretches the rules a little to allow a young woman to set up her sesame fruit-bar stand in the store. The other staff members soon become distracted by her beauty and Edna gets jealous.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: A Rosenbloom by Any Other Name
programme.desc: Jennifer's raise is delayed and she has put a down payment on a car. Bannister discovers a little old lady standing in the cold. Marlene plants the idea that Jennifer isn't getting the raise because she's black.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Edna is anxious to see where Howard is taking her tonight for their 6th Anniversary, but he seems to have forgotten. An old friend stops by to announce her new marriage which prompts Edna to look into Couples Therapy

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: The staff has prepared a little celebration for Bannister who won the "Manager of the Year" Award. The award comes with a trip to Hawaii, but when food goes missing, Bannister's new title and trip get put on the line.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: There isn't enough parking at Cobb's. Bannister finds himself parking in Christian's spot which leads to everyone starting to car-pool. Christian want's money from everyone for gas, but no one wants to pay. Bannister discovers Edna has been throwing out all of her parking tickets.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry falls asleep during jury duty but is awakened when the woman next to him passes him an obscene note which is actually a piece of evidence.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry's high-spirited father, Huey, comes to live in the apartment after he is booted out of his rest home for cavorting with women.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: A pro football star with a reputation as a womanizer hires Muriel to photograph him for a nude centerfold.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Jackie's hot romance with a new boyfriend cools down when his wife pays the Rushes a visit.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe's Easter vacation is ruined when his parents tell him they don't want him to come to Miami to see them.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: Cosmic Cow vs. the Oval Office
programme.desc: When Wainwright fires Henry for satirizing the President in his comic strip, Henry takes up painting with Monroe as his subject.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: A change of editors at his publishing company drives Henry to work for another publisher, but the new job is in New York.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: When Muriel's friend, a recent and happy divorcee, makes an appearance at the Rush household, Muriel has some second thought about married life.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Muriel mistakenly snaps a photo of a wanted gangster and the intrigue it causes leads Henry to believe she's having an affair.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Jackie shocks the family when she announces her plan to marry a surfer she met while on vacation in Hawaii.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: For Every Man There's Two Women
programme.desc: Henry takes the law into his own hands when the police refuse to search for the two women who assaulted Monroe.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: When Henry breaks his arm, his boss hires an ambitious young cartoonist to help with his comic strip.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Fear of being robbed strikes Henry and Monroe when they find a bag containing thousands of dollars and decide not to tell anyone.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: These Stupid Things Remind Me of You
programme.desc: A series of flashbacks trace Monroe's relationship with the Rushes.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Following the death of his father, Henry agonizes over who will give the eulogy at his own funeral.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Murray is saving to buy Bannister's old car, but at five dollars a payment, it's going too slow. He gets a tip from a customer for setting him up with another customer. Bannister dresses up to help Cobb'[s get a new deal, which leads to him getting arrested for running a house of prostitution.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister is panicking when an army buddy of his escapes prison to visit him. Cobb's hold a World Record Jump Rope competition.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: Love is a Many Splendored Alf
programme.desc: Alf puts makeup on an attractive lady shopping which leads to them going on a date. The freezers in the store blows up, and there's a mad scramble to keep the food frozen.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: The staff pose for the camera in bowling uniforms. They're trying to win a local bowling competition with a grand prize of 3,000. Edna wants to bowl, but Howard will only let her if someone else gets hurt. When their lead bowler breaks his arm, the store scrambles to find a replacement,

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Edna's mother is visiting on the same day Marlene is wearing a ring from some guy she doesn't know the name of. Edna tries on the ring and it gets stuck on her finger. Nothing will remove the ring, and the first thing her mother notices is the ring.

programme.desc: Ben learns a patient's son is making advances toward his daughter. Susan has tickets to the opera.

programme.desc: Helen's and David's birthday party is a disaster when first Stanley and Jeffrey and then Helen and Anne start squabbling.

programme.desc: Janet fumes when she inadvertently fixes up Terri with a guy she wanted to date herself.

programme.desc: Jack must come up with a "wife" to persuade his boss's man-hungry daughter that he's not available.

programme.desc: Jack tries to subdue a drunk at the Regal Beagle, but it's Terri who takes care of the masher with her karate skills.

programme.desc: Stanley's physical checkup for a life insurance policy has him convinced his days are numbered.

programme.desc: Mrs. Roper thinks her husband is having an affair when she finds his hidden stash of love letters , written to a woman named Doris.
